botanical_details.genus: Lilium are bulbous perennials with erect stems bearing whorled or spirally arranged leaves and terminal racemes or umbels of bowl-shaped, trumpet-shaped, funnel-shaped or turks cap shaped flowers, often fragrant, and white, yellow, orange or red

how_to_grow.cultivation: Plant bulbs in autumn at a depth of 2-3 times the height of the bulb. Grow in well-drained soil enriched with leaf mould or well-rotted organic matter in full sun or light shade. Grow in containers in loam-based potting compost (John Innes No2) with added grit, for conservatory or greenhouse cultivation grow in full light with shade from hot sun
how_to_grow.propagation: Propagate by offsets after the foliage dies down
how_to_grow.pruning: No pruning required. Tidy by deadheading flowers after they have faded
how_to_grow.pests: Susceptible to lily beetle and aphids and slugs may be problematic; plants in pots may be affected by vine weevil
how_to_grow.diseases: Grey moulds and a virus may cause problems. See lily diseases
